bow: how come nobody tells you that parenting newborn sucks also wish had been told this managed to forget and did it second time appreciate this brutal honesty it hard exhausted and sadly you do get much in return for few months before had kid thought they slept all day thought it would all be fun and games and now here am full of regrets would do it over again because masochist but would cut myself lot more slack and let the baby watch tv for short time if needed break to save my sanity because the aap people do try to tell but expectant parents do want to hear it look at babybumps to see all the rage directed at people who say things like that about the newborn phase gt because the aap yup my month old is making her way through my little pony at the moment will not fight her to go to sleep when can just turn on the cartoon lay in bed with her and she is instantly in better mood and asleep within one episode noshame if you knew me in real life would totally have told you imo toddlers are way more fun removed yes any time you try to throw some honesty their way you get slammed for being negative was so unprepared for the baby ended up with she was extraordinarily difficult and colicky and horrendous sleeper should have listened to the naysayers to at least prepare myself for the possibility parenting newborn as ftm sucked loved it the second time around would give anything for my life to be diapers and breastfeeding she now and cute as hell but damn spend my whole day disciplining think in the past and still in some places in the world new mother has more support during the first year or so of kid life if grandmothers or aunts did live with near the new family they would spend few months with them caring for the new mother baby and the rest of the family many cultures have moved away from that as well as having home births surrounded by grandmothers sisters and aunts looking back would have minded if someone handed me month old or if had the funds for night nurse parenting sucks in general think people do tell you because they do want to be alone in their misery my son was also very difficult baby my second child has totally different personality know that if had had her first would have thought knew everything about parenting newborns are angry angry little potatoes cute as hell but still furious little potatoes unless your lucky and get lazy quiet newborn but ve never seen this elusive potato take 10 newborns over toddler oy vey the threenager is strong with my kid ive always maintained love my kid but freaking hate being parent its the suckiest mind numbing most frustrating job ever my day is chaotic blend of being in total awe of this miraculous child and wishing hed go the fuck to sleep so can have moment to be myself again the second time around you re more relaxed because you ve already been through the hoops newborns are tough but they grow out of it sorry yup my son at is lot better company than he was as newborn yes it still inordinately hard work on the other hand he can at least now usually tell me what he wants instead of screaming until guess correctly love having my little partner in crime and genuinely enjoy the surreal conversations that give me glimpse into how he sees the world plus pretty sure enjoy the kids tv as much as he does newborn is due to put in an appearance in weeks and fully expecting it to suck royally all over again but at least this time know there light at the end of the tunnel and pretty soon ll have another toddler think you also have to be more relaxed because looking after your older child ren means you simply do have as much time to leap into panic mode over every small noise or minor worry sometimes the baby might just have to fuss for few minutes extra while you stop the toddler doing something fatal my sil had the elusive unicorn baby never really cried self soothed and slept through after just couple of weeks sweetest and most chilled nature of any baby ve met until she got mobile around months and now she terror so they do exist if only fleetingly together we be unstoppable it will suck but for me nothing sucked as much as the shock of the first time you are infinitely more confident in what you are doing and you know for sure that it does stay this way forever banking on having second like that probably an unpopular opinion but think newborns are super easy to care for mean currently pregnant with my 3rd kidlet and super excited to have kid that is into everything every seconds also one that takes nap for more than an hour or does nap at all similar situation here our first is little higher maintenance than the other even after few years after he was born we got few you must be doing it wrong from parents with kids that were lot less highly strung some comments on here reddit in general even got to the point of insinuating we are bad parents if we had our second first we would have thought we knew better parent before had my kid and also the new baby has company or at least another human to look at when you need to do chores eat shower etc etc think it just combo of your kid personalities and yours my daughter was really easy newborn and my son was really really awful also prefer the older kid stage think other parents also underestimate how difficult parenting is when you have kid who does sleep well sleep exhaustion sucks sleep exhaustion for years in row really sucks some kids just naturally sleep more better than others other parents seem to judge those parents mean come on who do you think wants sleep more you the onlooker or me the sleep deprived crazy lady pretty sure would do anything to make my kid sleep better do you think have tried all the things removed thats probably true both my kids were easy babies and did have problems when they were newborns but not with them have toddlers and starting the terrible its draining sometimes haha uh everyone does enjoy learning to cook fancy schmancy meals etc during my maternity leave ha ha ha honestly people forget for my wife and it was brutal first few weeks then the baby is super cute and cuddly and you watch potato when he cried as newborn and it just stuck my baby has been on the easy side think but between reddit and few parenting blogs feel like had very realistic expectations for labor delivery and the newborn stage there are so many resources at our disposal now kind of think anyone truly taken aback by the fact that parenting is hard did try to educate themselves at all you ca prepare for every situation of course but overall it should be pretty obvious that it an exhausting mindfuck still follow it and relied on it bit when was pregnant but that place is full of rants rants about husbands rants about mothers mothers in law rants about grandmas and coworkers and all the random strangers you name it plus lot of down voting definitely had to distance myself from it for bit unless you were lucky enough to have someone who had kid with colic spot your post then they were super supportive honestly unless you ve dealt with colic you just do really know the level person can sink and it good for the morale to speak to someone who can commiserate with one thing that really changed in tgat sub over the past years is that the general attitude and approval has swung radically from pro midwifery and homebirth to pro hospital medicated births as someone who left while it was still very much in the granola and admittedly much more accepting phase and still personally am moderately granola for the most part it has been quite jarring have unsubscribed like times during this pregnancy funny had the opposite experience felt like the odd man out for going with an obstetrician and wanting hospital birth with an epidural sorta got the impression so many had had bad experiences with the hospital setting and wanted to try it more naturally think part of it too was that the sub is and was mostly american moms midwifery is governed completely differently in places like canada where from and the uk where my midwife is from and the attitudes towards midwifery on the sub are mostly from americans perception and experiences with midwives vs obs so it gotten difficult to really relate to anyone experiences on there anymore plus people brushing off ideas like birth plans or as call them birth preferences and the overwhelming majority of people recommending going into labour essentially blind totally agree newborn stage is exhausting for sure and ve been relatively lucky with okay sleepers but definitely co slept at first so the sleep deprivation* was too terrible but think newborns are for the most part pretty predictable feed them change them cuddle them my older child though he was whoa it sucked every ounce of patience ever thought had *i have slept more than hours straight exactly times since my daughter was born in mid dec 2015 of them were in the past week still think newborns infants are easier my daughter did sleep through the night until stopped breastfeeding her at and kicked her out of my bed due to the impending new baby the new baby seems to be headed in the same direction made the choice to parent that way to share my bed and to not restrict breastfeeding but am over five years tired now because have barely had an uninterrupted night sleep in that timeframe and have slept in either oh you slept in until noon and you ca shake that sleepy feeling because you slept too long and now it 10 pm and poor you ca sleep because you re not tired yet let me play you the world smallest violin do people not just try to prepare for the worst do they think raising newborn is just piece of cake have even hatched yet but am just preparing at least trying to prepare myself for worst case scenarios maybe it because my mom has been trying to warn me but is it normal for people to think it going to be that easy have forgotten having three year old helps yes yes yes have three my first one was colicky nightmare screamed for hours straight every night until she turned months or so tried three different types of sleep training committed two weeks of crying each time and they did work for week two weeks crying for hours one week of decent sleep three times gave up because the stress of crying was worth it to me she did sleep through the night until all of her teeth came in my second one was boob addict he would wake up times night to nurse and screamed bloody murder if he did get his damn boob pacifier he also had night terrors and is generally high strung kid ve never experienced night terrors before but damn is it freaky sitting up in bed and screaming no no noooo hands pointing and shaking at some random point in the room or hands to his head and screaming and god forbid you try to comfort him he kick and flail like he was possessed he finally started sleeping better at but he still wakes up crying at but it sooo much easier to get him back to bed hug and kiss and lay him back to bed on baby number and he sleeps like crap too my mom insists not feeding him enough some nights he will hive me one hours stretch which is heavenly other nights he up every hours or 30 45 minutes exhausted absolutely exhausted know of couple real unicorn babies that sleep through the night from birth early on one of those mom was complaining how she had to get up once night when her daughter was potty training at 18 months she was sooo tired from getting up once night since she has never had to deal with waking up night for baby her kid genuinely slept on her own and would stay in her crib and play quietly until her mom would get her at 9am the kid is now and she really sweet smart and just good kid unicorn babies exist some of them even stay unicorn kids sigh my first is too second is 10 weeks old wish could ve remembered the long nights and sleep deprivation it did go by quickly though have almost too ve morning and have them be asleep then lay them down and have them wake up 15 minutes later because you forgot to change their diaper and then they do go back to sleep until am never heard from anyone quite how rough it actually is lol had preeclampsia with my first and had it post partum with my second yeah pregnancy can seriously eff you up got my tubes tied my ob was like good choice 3rd really would ve left you sick we ll have almost 13 year gap between our kids because we kept saying to ourselves what if the first one was the easy one due in more weeks and really hope that the first one
